title.narrative: Mental health services for children in Northern refugee camps of Lebanon

description.narrative: In order to promote the overall well-being of the Palestinian community in Lebanon this project aims 1) to enable resources for the two Family Guidance Centers (FGC) of Beit Atfal Assumoud (BAS) to deliver mental health services (assessment treatment and rehabilitation) for children suffering from mental health and developmental difficulties. The project supports these FGCs sole actors of mental health in North Lebanon to increase the prerequisites for healthy development of the child (promoting educationa l success preventing abuse and maltreatment). Another objective is to assist BAS to develop the mental health program towards community-based mental health model. According to it the specialized mental health professional gets a new role must be able to gi ve treatment intervention tasks to trained social workers and advise them on successful implementation. Due to the good cooperation network of both FGCs Beddawi and Nahr el-Bared the initial base for service model transition is already there. The project o rganises training and supervision in the new model methods e.g. task-shifting and home-based intervention. The background for this service development is demanding. The status of the refugee child in Lebanon is not a children'rights holder status but only the recipient of the UNRWA assistance. The mental health service culture in Lebanon is based on private clinic model not accessible and affordable to disadvantaged population. UNRWA the service provider for Palestinians lacks the special services for child ren especially the mental health services. The project outcome is twofold, implemented treatment of about 300-400 new referred children ?additional referrals displaced from Syria ? and about 600-800 children continuing their rehabilitation.However the FGCs invite all actors in the child's life to come and cooperate in the problem solution, family caregivers policy makers. Sponsosrhip program support the hardship case families.All activities of BAS are gender-balanced. Climate issue is handled especially in connection with the unhealthy housing issues of the families.FAFS has prepared the project plan together with BAS administration mental health program coordinators and with local the site units together. The financial costs of the project are yearly 220 00 0 ? self-financing 33 000 ? and official development funds 187 000 ? .
